Kemenhub Ungkap Modus yang Bikin Tol Laut Dimonopoli
01 Nov 2019, 10:58 by Herdi Alif Alhikam


Foto: Kemenhub

Jakarta - Kementerian Perhubungan mengungkap modus yang digunakan pihak-pihak yang memonopoli tol laut. Monopoli ini sendiri terjadi karena ada permasalahan pada ekosistem logistik.Direktur Lalu Lintas dan Angkutan Laut Ditjen Perhubungan Laut Wisnu Handoko mengatakan bahwa monopoli terjadi karena adanya perjanjian-perjanjian antara perusahaan pelayaran, pengirim barang dan penerima barang."Permasalahannya adalah pada ekosistem logistik. Perusahaan pelayaran, pengirim, penerima," ucap Wisnu di kantornya, Jumat (1/11/2019).Pertama, menurut Wisnu terjadi perjanjian antara pengirim barang dengan kapal pelayaran. Bahkan, modusnya hingga menggunakan nama perusahaan lain tapi sebetulnya perusahaannya sama."Shipper (pengirim) atau forwarder (perusahaan pelayaran) kuasai booking order container buat forwardernya. Bisa pakai nama berbeda tapi sama saja," papar Wisnu.Selanjutnya, ada beberapa yang merangkap menjadi penerima barang, meskipun beda perusahaan namun penerima barang di lokasi tujuan sudah bekerja sama dengan pengirim. Sehingga aliran barang hanya masuk ke satu sumber saja."Forwarder bisa bersamaan jadi consignee (penerima). Otomatis kan ada korelasi kok pake itu terus jasanya," ucap Wisnu.Karena sudah ada praktek kerja sama di tiga sektor tadi membuat suatu perusahaan operator pengirim barang dipastikan selalu mendapatkan orderan pengiriman. Sedangkan operator lain tidak mendapatkan pesanan."Yang layani forwarder jadi hanya beberapa saja 1, 2 atau 3 saja, jadinya itu-itu saja. Kecenderungan kalau itu saja harga pun jadi tinggi karena tak ada pilihan lagi," lanjut Wisnu. Simak Video "Jokowi Sebut Ada Pihak Swasta Nakal Main-main di Tol Laut"[Gambas:Video 20detik](zlf/zlf)

Ministry of Transportation Reveals Mode That Makes Sea Tolls Monopolized
01 Nov 2019, 10:58 by Herdi Alif Alhikam


Photo: Ministry of Transportation

Jakarta - The Ministry of Transportation revealed the mode used by those who monopolized the sea toll. This monopoly itself occurs because there are problems in the logistics ecosystem. Director of Sea Transportation and Sea Transportation Director General of Sea Transportation Wisnu Handoko said that the monopoly occurred because of agreements between shipping companies, shippers and recipients of goods. "The problem is in the logistics ecosystem. Shipping companies , sender, recipient, "said Wisnu in his office, Friday (11/01/2019). First, according to Wisnu, an agreement was made between the sender of goods and the shipping vessel. In fact, the mode is to use the name of another company but actually the company is the same. "Shipper (sender) or forwarder (shipping company) controls the booking order container for the forwarder. Can use different names but just the same," said Wisnu. Furthermore, there are several who concurrently become recipient of goods, even though the company is different, the recipient of the goods at the destination location has cooperated with the sender. So that the flow of goods only goes to one source. "Forwarders can simultaneously become consignees (recipients). There is no correlation automatically, why use it to continue to service," said Wisnu. Because there is already the practice of cooperation in the three sectors that made a company sending goods operators certainly always get a delivery order. While other operators do not get orders. "The one who serves the forwarders is only a few, two or three, so that's it. The tendency is that even prices will be high because there is no choice," continued Wisnu.
